name: YouTube Community Post
primary_goal_vibe: Lightweight touchpoints between uploads: updates, conversation starters, and quick engagement with subscribers.
tone_preference: Conversational, concise, and creator-like. Feels direct and personal, not like a formal announcement.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: Keep posts short and focused on a single idea. Use questions, prompts, or simple updates to drive comments and reactions. Avoid long paragraphs; community posts should be scannable.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Line 1: core update or question. Optional line 2–3: short context or detail. Final line: simple CTA to comment, vote, or watch something.
cta_examples: What do you want to see next
Check out the new video on the channel
Vote in the poll and tell me why

text_post.caption_role: Primary content. The text itself is the message.

image_post.caption_role: Explain or contextualize the image and invite feedback or ideas.

poll_post.caption_role: Frame the poll question and why it matters.

video_snippet_post.caption_role: Direct attention to the full video or tease what is inside.
video_snippet_post.cta_focus: Clicks to watch the full video.

hashtags_mentions.recommended_hashtags: Optional and minimal. Use 0–3 hashtags if they add clarity.
hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Community posts are not primarily discovery tools; use hashtags sparingly.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Mention collaborators or channels when cross-promoting content.

technical_constraints.visibility_note: Community posts are primarily shown to subscribers and active viewers.
technical_constraints.media_support: Supports text, images, GIFs, polls, and video links.
technical_constraints.frequency_recommendation: Low to moderate frequency. 1–4 posts per week depending on channel size.

required_elements: At least one question or CTA for engagement
disallowed_practices: Posting only promotional links with no context
Multiple unrelated ideas in one post
Overposting to the point of feed fatigue
